This marks the second time the structure has been targeted in less than a year.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: It has been described as an epidemic linked to the gradual aging of humanity.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: Alzheimer's, a disease that steals the very identity of those afflicted by it and irreparably erodes their mental faculties.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: Until recently, there's been no effective treatment.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: Now, American pharmaceutical company Eli Lilly says it's developed a new drug, the Nanomab, that slows cognitive decline in Alzheimer's patients by up to 35%, a potential game changer if taken early.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: We're actually about to start a trial called primary prevention in people with genetic Alzheimer's disease. They know they have a mutation, but they are 25 years or so before they're due to get symptoms. The aim is, if you can give them an anti-amyloid therapy, can you prevent the disease ever starting? And we're going to start that in the next few months, which I think is really exciting.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: Eli Lilly is now calling on health authorities to approve the Nanumab, which works in the same way as the Canumab, approved for use in the US earlier this month. Somewhere in the Black Mountains of Wales, an unlikely crop is being cultivated.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_14
sentences.sentence: Daffodils which are grown at higher altitudes hold a special power.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_14
sentences.sentence: They produce a crucial medical compound, a key component in pills to combat Alzheimer's.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Recent studies reveal another potentially astonishing benefit. Early evidence shows high altitude daffodils produce extract which when fed to cows has the unique ability to reduce methane emissions. The challenge to get flower crops to grow consistently on mountaintops. We found when we tried to grow daffodils here, that all the traditional practices from the daffodil industry from decades didn't work and didn't apply.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: In the end, we had to throw out the rule book and completely reinvent the whole process from start to finish.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_14
sentences.sentence: The daffodil is synonymous with Wales. It's the national flower of the country.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_14
sentences.sentence: But the last place you'd expect it to be grown here is the Black Mountains.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_14
sentences.sentence: The reason it is, although it's challenging, is because these conditions are the perfect conditions to produce the crucial compound when it comes to reducing methane.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: It became apparent very quickly that daffodils are packed full of very powerful bioactive compounds.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_14
sentences.sentence: Cows and other farm animals contribute approximately 14% of human-induced climate emissions.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_14
sentences.sentence: Scientists are hopeful that as well as reducing emissions, daffodil extract can make animal digestive systems more efficient.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: What we also are expecting to see is an improvement in protein utilization, which means that we can start looking at animal diets and perhaps reducing some of the protein they're getting in because they're going to get more out of what's being fed.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: So that's also a really promising benefit from this additive.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_14
sentences.sentence: The UK government is now backing a four-year trial, which, if successful, could have profound implications.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_14
sentences.sentence: It's quite an unreal situation. In front of us now, the potential it could make to change the world on a number of levels, it's incredibly exciting and very scary.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: While not the only solution to climate change, this trial has the potential to reduce greenhouse gas emissions and help slow down the increasing global temperatures.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_14
sentences.sentence: Luke Hanrahan, Euronews, Wales.
